parts:
To delete **all pods, services, and deployments** in a specific Kubernetes namespace **without deleting secrets**, you can use `kubectl delete` with label selectors or resource types.

Here‚Äôs a safe and targeted approach:

---

### üîß **Delete Deployments, Services, and Pods Only**
```bash
kubectl delete deployments,services,pods --all -n <namespace>
```

This will:
- Delete **all deployments** in the namespace (which will delete the pods created by them),
- Delete **all services**, and
- Delete **any standalone pods**.

**It will NOT delete secrets, configmaps, PVCs, etc.**

---

### üß™ Optional: Dry Run First
To verify what will be deleted:
```bash
kubectl delete deployments,services,pods --all -n <namespace> --dry-run=client -o name
```

---

### üöÄ Bonus: Delete Other Non-Secret Resources (Optional)
If you also want to delete other resources (like `replicasets`, `statefulsets`, `daemonsets`, etc.) but still exclude secrets:

```bash
kubectl api-resources --verbs=delete --namespaced -o name | \
  grep -v '^secrets$' | \
  xargs -n1 kubectl delete --all -n <namespace>
```

This will:
- Get all namespaced resources that support `delete`,
- Exclude `secrets`,
- Delete everything else in that namespace.

‚ö†Ô∏è **Make sure you trust the output** before running this in production.
